feed.title: SAP Community - NW ABAP Gateway (OData)
feed.subtitle: NW ABAP Gateway (OData) Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Problem with ODATA /IWBEP/USERMANAGEMENT (/IWBEP/CM_MGW_RT/027)
entry.content:
Good morning,

After activating the OData service /IWBEP/USERMANAGEMENT, I‚Äôm able to use the CurrentUser and UserCollection('UserName') endpoints successfully.

However, when I attempt to call UserCollection to retrieve all user entities, I receive the following error:

"code": "/IWBEP/CM_MGW_RT/027",
"message": {
   "lang": "en",
   "value": "Operation 'Query' not supported for entity type 'User'"
}

According to the service metadata, calling UserCollection should return all user entities.

Could you please confirm whether this issue is due to:

  • The UserCollection entity set not being implemented by SAP in this standard service, or

  • A misconfiguration on our application server side?

Have a nice day.

entry.title: Fiori Elements: Display Tree-Structure using OData Annotation (Code Based)
entry.content:
Hello,

I want to create a Tree Table with Fiori Elements using SEGW, but I'm not able to do so.

I try to follow this posts:
Fiori Elements: Display Tree-Structure using OData... - SAP Community
Fiori Elements Tree Table with SAP Annotations - SAP Community

This is my data table:

This are the fields:

 

These are my CDS Views:

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@EndUserText.label: 'Intermediate View for Tree Structure'

define view entity ZCDS_I_TREE_STRUCTURE

as select from ztree_table

{

key id,

parentid,

hierlevel,

drilldownstate,

nodename,

nodedescription

}

 

@EndUserText.label: 'Konsumptions-View f√ºr ZTREE_TABLE'

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

//@OData.publish: true

@UI.headerInfo: {

typeName: 'Knoten',

typeNamePlural: 'Knoten'

}

@Hierarchy.parentChild: [{

name: 'TreeHierarchy',

recurse: {

parent: ['parentid'],

child: ['id']

},

siblingsOrder: [{

by: 'nodename',

direction: #ASC

}],

rootNode: {

visibility: #ADD_ROOT_NODE_IF_DEFINED

},

orphanedNode: {

handling: #ROOT_NODES

}

}]

define view entity ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTURE

as select from ZCDS_I_TREE_STRUCTURE

{

 

key id,

parentid,

hierlevel,

drilldownstate,

@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 10, label: 'Node Name' }]

nodename,

@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'Node Description' }]

nodedescription

}

 

 

In SEGW I created a project and the did a right click on "Data Model"  then "Reference" / "Data Source" and chose my ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTURE. Icreated the runtime objects and redefined the method "define" in my *MPC_EXT class with the following code:


METHOD define.
  super->define( ).

  DATA: lr_entity    TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_entity_typ,
        lr_property  TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_property,
        lr_annotation TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotation.

  lr_entity = model->get_entity_type( iv_entity_name = 'ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTUREType' ).
  IF lr_entity IS BOUND.

    " 1. id als Knoten-ID
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'id' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_node_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 2. RELATKEY als Parent Node
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'parentid' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_parent_node_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 3. SeqNo als Hierarchieebene
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'hierlevel' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_level_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 4. drill_state als Drill-Down-Zustand
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'drilldownstate' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_drill_state_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

  ENDIF.
ENDMETHOD.

If I create then the Responsive Table in the BAS, it shows me my data correctly. When I change to type "TreeTable", it shows me "No data found".

What am I doing wrong?

Thanks and best regards
Thomas

@MR_srinivas 
@SumitKundu 
@jmalla

entry.title: How to retrieve multiple tables at once using SAP Gateway Service Builder
entry.content:
Using SAP Gateway Service Builder, I am implementing Association and GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET methods based on the following article.

https://www.sapyard.com/odata-and-sap-netweaver-gateway-part-iv-association-and-navigation-in-odata-service/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hTNclt8sM2c
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K0yuFRQRygY&list=PLl_MEz33D2N0NvudI_oxOuRW5XMamXe5l&index=28

In the article, both the retrieval of the Principal table (TABLE1) and the Dependent table (TABLE2) are described using GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET. However,
when I actually execute the API with $expand, GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET is executed multiple times.
The retrieval of Principal data is successful, but I am unable to retrieve Dependent data.
Please tell me the correct implementation method for GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET.
Also, is it normal for GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET to be executed multiple times with a single API execution?


The following is other information.

„Éªsourcecode

DATA: BEGIN OF ts_deep_entity.
INCLUDE TYPE /<package>/<mpc>=>ts_table1.
DATA: table2Set TYPE /<package>/<mpc>=>tt_table2,
END OF ts_deep_entity.

DATA:it_deep_entity LIKE TABLE OF ts_deep_entity,
wa_deep_entity LIKE LINE OF it_deep_entity.
DATA: it_info TYPE /<package>/<mpc>=>tt_table1,
it_item TYPE /<package>/<mpc>=>tt_table2.

CASE IV_ENTITY_SET_NAME.
WHEN 'table1Set'.
SELECT * FROM /<package>/table1
INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @IT_deep_entity.
LOOP AT it_deep_entity INTO wa_deep_entity.
SELECT * FROM /<package>/table2 INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @IT_item.
" WHERE parentid= @its_deep_entity-id.
MOVE-CORRESPONDING it_item TO wa_deep_entity-table2Set.
ENDLOOP.

CALL METHOD me->/iwbep/if_mgw_conv_srv_runtime~copy_data_to_ref
EXPORTING
is_data = it_deep_entity
CHANGING
cr_data = ER_ENTITYSET.
WHEN 'table2Set'.

‚Ä¢ When checking the value of IV_ENTITY_SET_NAME in the debugger,
the first execution returns the Principal EntitySet value, and subsequent executions return the Dependent EntitySet value.
Additionally, GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET is executed once for each row in the Principal table (Table1) plus one extra execution.

entry.title: Extend FDP_EF_PURCHASE_ORDER for a logo
entry.content: ive made a copy the FDP_EF_PURCHASE_ORDER correctly without issue. I wanted to add an entity type for the logo, and created it without issue, i've also make the association to PurchaseOrderNote, also created the entityset and regenerate the service, but i can't find the new method (logocontrol_get_entity or logocontrol_get_entityset ) in the DC_EXT class although the association exists, therefore i can't redefine them. Could help me understanding what i'm missing? Why do not i have the new method in the dataprovider? thank you in advance

entry.title: Can AWS AppFlow Integrate with SAP OData Services in Trial Account (S/4HANA or BTP)?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I‚Äôm currently working with an SAP trial account (SAP BTP Free Tier with Integration Suite enabled), and I'm trying to test integration with AWS AppFlow.

üîπ My goal is:

  • Let users authenticate via SAP (OAuth 2.0 flow)

  • Access SAP OData APIs (e.g., API_BUSINESS_PARTNER)

  • Use AWS AppFlow to pull/push data via those OData endpoints

üîç My Questions:

  1. Does the SAP trial environment allow external systems like AWS AppFlow to connect to OData services via OAuth 2.0?

  2. If not, is there any SAP offering (e.g., partner edition or developer edition) where this integration is technically possible?

  3. Are there any working examples, blog posts, or documentation specifically about using AppFlow with SAP OData from BTP/S/4HANA?

üîß Context:

  • I have access to Integration Suite and can configure OAuth client credentials

  • I have reviewed the AWS AppFlow docs, but they assume externally accessible SAP endpoints

  • In my trial, I cannot seem to expose OData APIs publicly or connect AppFlow

Would appreciate guidance on what's possible and how to set it up for testing purposes.

Thank you,

entry.title: Smart table does not show CDS view results
entry.content:
I was trying to display the sales document number on my Smart Table using CDS views. However, it only shows blank. What are wrong with my code?

<smartTable:SmartTable
  id="Results"
  enableAutoBinding="true"
  editable="false"
>
<Table items="{/ZSD_C_SDOC}">
<columns>
 <Column>
  <Text text="Sales Document"/>
 </Column>
</columns>
<items>
 <ColumnListItem>
  <cells>
   <Text text="{SalesDocNo}"/>
  </cells>
 </ColumnListItem>
</items>
</Table>
</smartTable:SmartTable>

 

@odata.publish: true
@EndUserText.label: 'Test CDS View'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true

define root view ZSD_C_SDOC as select from vbak
{
 key vbeln as SalesDocNo
}

entry.title: Custom Fiori app displays placeholder instead of actual value from Odata
entry.content:
The app is connected to an odata service that gets data from vbak. I am trying to display the Sales Document Number 

CurrentExpected
Sales document no(header)Sales document no (header)
SalesDocument_01000000123
SalesDocument_01000000124
SalesDocument_01000000125

In my cds: it is declared that 

key vbak.vbeln  as SalesDocument

XML
<smartTable:SmartTable>
 <Table items="{Z_VBAKTEST}">
  <columns>
   <Column>
    <Text text="Sales Document No">
   <Column>
  </columns>
  <items>
   <ColumnListItem>
    <Text text="{SalesDocument}"/>
   <ColumnListItem>
  </items>
 </Table>
</smartTable:SmartTable>

entry.title: Gateway: "400, Bad request" by raising business exception
entry.content:
In a SAP Gateway Project (SEGW) I am raising a business exception in a *_DELETE_ENTITY method on backend side as:

METHOD xy_delete_entity.
"...
DATA(lo_msg_cont) = me->/iwbep/if_mgw_conv_srv_runtime~get_message_container( ).
lo_msg_cont->reset( ).
lo_msg_cont->add_message(
            iv_msg_type               = 'E'                 " Message Type
            iv_msg_id                 = '42'
            iv_msg_number             = '785' "URL: &1                 " Message Number
            iv_msg_v1                 = CONV #( lv_uri )                 " Message Variable
        ).

        DATA(lv_http_status_code) = '200'. "or '400'
        RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception
          EXPORTING
            message_container      = lo_msg_cont
            http_status_code       = CONV  #( lv_http_status_code )  
        .

If works well, except that I get a "400 Bad request" in /IWFND/GW_CLIENT, like if technical error /IWBEP/CX_MGW_TECH_EXCEPTION was raised.
I checked as follows:

  • In /IWFND/GW_CLIENT I get "400 Bad request"
  • In /IWFND/ERROR_LOG I see my error with HTTP Status Code depending on what I use in Parameter HTTP_STATUS_CODE while raising, 200, 400 etc, but still error.
  • My messages are correctly contained in the response
  • I could not detect raising /IWBEP/CX_MGW_TECH_EXCEPTION in debugger.
  • Update of this post: in the Response I could find the top error message as SY/530. This corresponds to the T100 Message "An exception was raised". I could not catch this message in debugger.

I already made a few projects in a similar way (indeed with READ and UPDATE, never with DELETE) and all went good. What could be wrong here?

BTW, on client side (Fiori App) this causes an annoying popup "Technial error occured. Please try again later" and afterwards all is OK (Message Popover filled correctly with messages).

Thanks!

KR,

Igor

entry.title: Method abcd__GET_ENTITYSET is not implemented- Calling RFC FM
entry.content:
Hi ,

I am calling a RFC function module in my gateway project. My RFC Fm returns just one line of data (XML String ) in an export parameter.

I Created data model by import->RFC and in the service implementation getEntity I did Map to data Source.

Now When I execute my request

/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSD_XXXX_XXXX_READ_SRV/InputParamSet?$format=json

 

I get 501 error saying " "value" : "Method 'INPUTPARAMSET_GET_ENTITYSET' not implemented in data provider class"

entry.title: OData Service ‚Äî Data Retrieved in Debug, but HTTP 500 Error After Execution
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am developing an OData service to retrieve Sales Order header and item data.

What I did:

Imported a DDIC structure into my MPC.

Implemented the logic in GET_ENTITY and GET_ENTITYSET methods.

When I test the service in /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE or the browser, the data appears correctly during debugging.

The issue:
After I press F8 to let the request finish, I get an HTTP 500 error with the message:
In the context of Data Services an unknown internal server error occurred.
Transaction ID: 08BBE93FEEFF0010E006884DDA300316
Timestamp: 2025-08-15 06:29:14
Suggestion: Run /IWFND/ERROR_LOG as per SAP Note 1797736

My question:
Why does this happen only after execution, even though the data is retrieved correctly in debug mode?
Could this be due to metadata type mismatch or another common OData serialization issue?

Thank you in advance for your guidance
Ashok

entry.title: Force SAP OData to return a SAP_SESSIONID cookie
entry.content:
Hello.

We recently updated our SAP with the EPH8 last Sunday.

However, after the update, sometimes our third-party API Manager is not receiving the Cookie "SAP_SESSIONID_XXX" when sending the X-CSRF-Token request.

Please, is there anything else we can do to force to always return this "SAP_SESSIONID_XXX" Cookie?
Without it, we are not being able to authenticate with our ODATA service sometimes. I mean, it's intermittent - sometimes work while sometimes it doesn't, specially during the night > morning.

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: SAP Fiori not calling Odata. RAP Preview working fine
entry.content:
Hi,

In my current project, I‚Äôm developing a SAP Fiori app using Visual Studio Code. However, the main challenge is that VS Code isn‚Äôt connected to the SAP backend. To work around this, I‚Äôm downloading an existing app using the standard program /UI5/UI5_REPOSITORY_LOAD, making the necessary changes locally, and then uploading it back to the SAP backend using the same program. This process creates a BSP application.

The backend OData service has been generated using RAP. When I preview the service binding in Eclipse, everything works perfectly‚Äîthe OData call is successful, and the view is rendered correctly. 

The Network tab in the Edge browser‚Äôs Developer Tools confirms this, as shown in the screenshot. No issues so far.

To replicate this behavior in my standalone Fiori app, I checked the source in the app preview to identify the URI being called.

I then used this exact URI in the manifest.json file of my app in VS Code. The screenshot below shows the manifest.json from my standalone VS Code project.

However, when I test the app using SE80 (by right-clicking and selecting Test in SAPGUI after uploading), the OData service isn‚Äôt being called, and the view isn‚Äôt generated. The screen remains blank. The Network tab in Edge shows no OData activity, and although the Console logs some generic errors, they also appear in other working apps.

I‚Äôve checked all the usual places for errors‚Äî/IWFND/ERROR_LOG, ST22, SLG1, and SU53‚Äîbut found nothing relevant.

Network in Developer tool of the Edge browser doesn't show any Odata call.

Console shows some error, but these are generic error which I can see in other apps as well which are working just fine.

I‚Äôm stuck at this point and would really appreciate any guidance on what might be going wrong or what else I can check.

Thanks,

entry.title: My inbox PO enhancement with PO Changes as a composition
entry.content:
Hello, i'm trying to add a table of PO Changes made using CDS View into the Purchase Order Approval detail page in My Inbox.

I tried the mentioned blog below, but no success yet.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/my-inbox-po-enhancement-with-approvers-as-a-composition/qaa-p/12673395#M4754835

I made the following CDS View to show the purchase changes and added it to C_PurchaseOrderFs Extension.

After that, i made a enhancement into MPC_EXT as mentioned in the blog trying to add the association into the Metadata of the SEGW service C_PURCHASEORDER_FS.

 

But, the change is not reflecting yet in the My Inbox App, i only see a new area with the title but no table is displayed there.
i have already tried to extend the SEGW service, but it does not work with My inbox. I also tried a new service, but that didn't work also. As i understood from the blog, the guys were able to solve it using the standard service and adding some enhancement only, but the main problem here is that i'm not able to see the associations and also, i'm unable to add the associations. 
Do you guys have any idea on how i could solve it?

thanks.

entry.title: Odata metadata error : Model 'ZGW_XXX_MDL_0001_BE' contains errors. Contact Adminstrator
entry.content:
We are experiencing a failure in metadata calls from the application in our environment. The issue is impacting the functionality of OData services and causing delays in data retrieval.

Steps Taken:

  1. Cleared Gateway (GW) cache,
  2. Checked the Service maint configuration.
  3. All network and connection are good.

error: Model 'ZGW_SMS_MDL_0001_BE' contains errors. Contact Adminstrator

error id:  /IWFND/MED039

url: /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZGW_XXX_SRV/$metadata

We request assistance in analyzing the root cause of the metadata call failure. Please advise on:

  • Any known issues or patches related to metadata failures.
  • Recommended steps to debug or resolve the issue.
  • Whether additional Gateway or backend configurations need to be reviewed.

Note: we are facing this issue as intermittent.

entry.title: Population of field TECHDESC in table USR21
entry.content:
Since recent upgrade to SAP S/4HANA, we have noticed that some workflows are checking for a value in field TECHDESC in table USR21.

In table USR21 field TECHDESC, we have records that are populated with First Name & Last Name, and we have blank records in that field also.

We would like to know what is the data flow path / update mechanism, for the field TECHDESC to get populated with a value?  Is there a link to HR infotype to obtain the person's first name & last name?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: What's the best way to call or use my custom Data Provider Class on my v4 OData service?
entry.content:
Since v4 Odata service uses standard class, what's the best approach on calling or using the custom model for data provider class?

Context: My Odata service is connected to custom fiori app. Also, i have created a custom class that contains custom logic. My behavior definition also calls the custom class that I've had created.

Objective: When an action button is used/pressed, I would like to call the class ZCL_QM_TEST which I would like to call the specific action which is get_entity.

Behavior definition code:

managed implementation in class ZCL_TEST unique;
strict ( 2 );

define behavior for Z_TEST_CDS
persistent table qals
lock master
authorization master ( instance )

{
   create;
   update;
   delete;
   field( mandatory ) InpsectionLot;

   action get_entity result [0..*] $self;
}

entry.title: Nested parameterised cds view
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,
I have been facing issues with nested parameterised views that results into error : "DATABASE RETURN SQL CODE 7 : Feature not supported :Parameterised view with unused Parameter" .

Just to give you a brief ;
I m querying on standard parameterised view from a custom cds view and supplying all input parameters to standard cds view F2_MMIM_MATSTOCKQUANVALBYDATE .

Pls help or give any recommendations to follow the right approach .

Attach find screen shots of cds and error 
Thanks
Anil
